vocabulary.definition: a seemingly contradictory statement that may nonetheless be true
vocabulary.example: The concept of time travel creates a paradox where one can change the past to alter the future.
The unloving treatment from his parents left a lasting impact on his emotional well-being.

vocabulary.definition: to force or drive someone to do something
vocabulary.example: Her passion for the cause compelled her to speak up against injustice.

vocabulary.definition: to restrict within limits; to define or mark the limits of something
vocabulary.example: The rules circumscribe the actions of the participants in the competition.

vocabulary.definition: wasted away or diminished in size due to disuse
vocabulary.example: His muscles had atrophied after being in a cast for several weeks.

vocabulary.definition: the quality of having or showing a wish to do evil to others
vocabulary.example: The villain's eyes gleamed with malevolence as he planned his next malicious act.
